summary:
(RAG Format)
The patient presents with unresolved emotional distress related to genetic testing experiences, feelings of being disregarded by medical professionals, and a persistent sense of being overlooked in familial dynamics. She expresses a recurring pattern of self-blame and self-violence in her efforts to assert herself. She has a teenage daughter who is currently undergoing therapy, and a husband who is minimally engaged in the therapeutic process.
main_issues: - Persistent feelings of being disregarded by medical and familial figures
- Difficulty asserting her needs without feeling guilty
- Challenges in engaging her husband in the therapeutic process
- Concerns about her daughter's therapeutic progress and emotional well-being
limiting_beliefs: - 'I must handle everything on my own.'
- 'My needs are less important than others.'
- 'If I assert myself, I will be seen as aggressive or unreasonable.'
therapeutic_goals: - Strengthen self-assertion without guilt or self-violence
- Encourage healthy communication with her husband regarding family dynamics
- Support her in setting boundaries with medical professionals
- Assist in the processing of past medical encounters to reduce emotional distress
- Foster emotional regulation techniques to manage frustration and resentment
motivational_closure: Your voice matters. Your needs are valid. With each step, you are reclaiming your space and your right to be seen and heard â€” not as an afterthought, but as a priority.
